content.rendered:
Cochlear Implants: What’s new? What’s next?

 

The following video segments are from a Research Symposium featured at the HLAA 2022 Convention in Tampa, Florida. Top researchers discuss CIs, small implantable devices that can restore some hearing for people with severe to profound hearing loss.

  • Cochlear Implants – What Are They? This video defines what a CI is and how it works.
  • Cochlear Implants – What’s New? This video looks at new CI research & technology.
  • Cochlear Implants – What’s Next?  This video focuses on the future of CIs. 

What are They?

What’s New?

What’s Next?

The 2022 Research Symposium is supported, in part, by a grant from the National Institute on Deafness and Other Communication Disorders, National Institutes of Health (Award Number R13DC017913).

Full Research Symposium can be viewed here.

To learn more about some personal CI success stories, read this blog post.
